apart.core.controlled_traffic_rates —- Controlled traffic rates mechanism¶

This module contains material to manage the traffic counters of the controlled traffic rates mechanism of the protocol.

class apart.core.controlled_traffic_rates.TrafficController(delta_r, neighbors)[source]¶

Bases: object

This class stores and manages the traffic counters of a node. More exactly, it manages the counters n_i_real, n_i_real over the last delta_r rounds, and manages one counter n_i_dum, n_o_dum per neighbor, for the last delta_r rounds.

Parameters:
  • delta_r (int) – the number of rounds over which the traffic rates contraints are relaxed.
  • neighbors (list of int) – the indexes (in the network) of the neighbors of the node to which a particular TrafficController instance belongs to.
equilibrate_n_o_real_and_n_i_real()[source]¶

Called at the end of a round, updates n_o_real and n_i_real.

This function effectively cancels out values of n_i_real with values of n_o_real, or vice-versa, depending on which one is the greatest of the two2

inc_current_n_i_dum(neighbor, inc=1)[source]¶

Increments the n_i_dum counter of the current round by the specified value

inc_current_n_i_real(inc=1)[source]¶

Increments the n_i_real counter of the current round by the specified value

inc_current_n_o_dum(neighbor, inc=1)[source]¶

Increments the n_o_dum counter of the current round by the specified value

inc_current_n_o_real(inc=1)[source]¶

Increments the n_o_real counter of the current round by the specified value

next_round()[source]¶

Move the counters to the next round

Depending on the implementation, this function may involve a rotation of queues for instance

resolve_n_i_real_with_dummies()[source]¶

Called at the end of a round, to decrease n_i_real according to the dummy budget

This function effectively consumes outgoing dummy budget to resolve potentially unresolved n_i_real

resolve_n_o_real_with_dummies()[source]¶

Called at the end of a round, to decrease n_o_real according to the dummy budget

This function effectively consumes incoming dummy budget to resolve potentially unresolved n_o_real

current_equilibrium¶

int – The equilibrium of the counters, i.e. the sum over the last delta_r rounds of n_o_real-n_i_real

last_unresolved_n_i_real¶

int – the value of n_i_real for the oldest rounds, that must to be resolved in the current round

last_unresolved_n_o_real¶

int – the value of n_o_real for the oldest rounds, that must to be resolved in the current round

total_n_i_dum_budget¶

int – total incoming dummy budget

total_n_o_dum_budget¶

int – total outgoing dummy budget

total_unresolved_n_i_real¶

int – the total excess (compared to sent ones) of received real messages

total_unresolved_n_o_real¶

int – the total excess (compared to received ones) of sent real messages
